title: Final Fantasy XIV Is TOO Popular For Square Enix To Cope With - Kinda Funny Games Daily 12.16.21
description:
Go to http://creditkarma.com/loanoffers to find the loan for you!

Go to http://amazon.com/kfgd to try Amazon Music Unlimited FREE for THREE months!

Go to http://greenchef.com/kfgd10 and use code KFGD10 to get 10 free meals including free shipping!

Go to http://butcherbox.com/kfgd to get $20 off our first five boxes plus one pack of bacon for FREE for life!

Tim and Tam talk about new Splinter Cell remake info, changes at Bungie, Square Enix struggling to cope with Final Fantasy XIV's popularity, and more!

Time Stamps - 
00:00:00 - Start
00:08:12 - Housekeeping
This is our last week of regular content for the year before we go on break!
The Blessing Show will be the last piece of Kinda Funny Games content of the year and that goes up on Monday the 20th.
We’ll be back on January 3rd.
Our Spider-Man No Way Home spoiler-free review is up today as a Screencast. That is me, Tim, Joey, and Kevin giving all of our thoughts on the movie without giving anything away. You can catch that on Youtube.com/kindafunny and podcast services around the globe.
Thank you to our Patreon Producers: Pranksy, Black Jack, & Greg Miller Returns to Content Next Month, Nick Should Quit Now!
The Roper Report -
00:10:50 - First Splinter Cell Remake Details Shared – GameSpot, Jessica Howard
00:22:15 - Bungie CEO Responds To Report Of Toxic Workplace Culture – GameSpot, James Carr
00:33:10 - Ad  
00:37:26 - FFXIV Sales Suspended Due To Server Congestion – GameSpot, Jenny Zheng
00:43:15 - Ernie Hudson says a new Ghostbusters game is “definitely happening,” confirms his involvement – Ghost Busters News
00:49:00 - Out today Reader mail -
00:57:00 - congrats - Takibi
00:58:50 - You‘re Wrong

talk about this yesterday yeah or or the day before yeah this is an ongoing thing coming stemming from the report that ign's uh uh rebecca valentine did we're gonna come to an update for from her as well so developer bungie has released a statement in response to a report that it has struggled with issues of sexism and crunch in the workplace a letter written by bungie ceo pete parsons was released shortly after ign published a report in which he focused uh on the changes bungie has made in recent history while acknowledging the company has more work to do and that these changes do not erase any pain employees have suffered reports include statements and experiences from 26 current and former employees most of which spoke anonymously describe bungie that uh had dealt with issues of abusive management across nearly every department since 2011. in many instances the department leaders and managers would belittle overwork and abuse people in their department often targeting women and

management across nearly every department since 2011. in many instances the department leaders and managers would belittle overwork and abuse people in their department often targeting women and people of color um so in the past uh letting from parsons uh he doesn't deny or refute the report but he still focuses on the improvement bungie has made in recent years says i'm not here to refute or challenge the experiences we're seeing shared today by people who have graced our studio with their time and talent our actions or in some cases inactions causes people pain i apologize personally and on behalf of everyone at bungie who i feel a deep sense of empathy and sadness reading through these accounts parsons wrote list of the changes made including the removal of some bad actors at bungie however they acknowledge that this can only occur when brave people come forward he also stated that bungie has not always done this publicly nor has it done it as quickly as it should have parson
